notesStmt.note: Folios 86, 118, 127, 130-132, 135, 137, 149, 187 are mutilated, with loss of text.

There are number of marginal comments in various parts of the manuscript, taken for the most part from Rashi, Radak abd Rabenu Yeshayah (e.g. 139v, 51v), written approximately in 16th and 17th century handwriting.Folio 192r, a Judeo-Arabic inscription.Folios 193v-195r, a number of Hebrew poems, some verses in Judeo-Arabic. Yeshu'ah ben Ya῾aḳov ben Yehudah Al-Habishi, inscribed with his name in the colophon, folio 190v, with a date of 1500.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Former Prophets, accentuated and punctuated, with masorah magna and parva.

collation.p: 20 quires of 10 leaves each, apart from the first of 8 leaves and the last of 7 leaves only. The quires are signed with Hebrew letters on the first page.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine: 'Former Prophets. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2369.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), a antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 23 July 1881 (folio [197v]).
